wikipedia_page.main: James Stott (15 November 1919 – 6 July 1994) was an English professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1930s, 1940s and 1950s. He played at representative level for Great Britain, England and Lancashire, and at club level for United Glass Bottle ARLFC (now Eccleston Lions ARLFC  (in Eccleston, St Helens) of the North West Men's League), and St Helens, as a centre, i.e. number 3 or 4. Jim Stott was a Private in the British Army during World War II, and appeared for Wigan as a World War II guest player.
